Player History
Released by Cleveland on 3/2/1965...
Drafted in 1st round, 9th overall pick, by Chicago (N) in 1968...
Injured on 5/21/1969 with a Torn Groin Muscle, out for 6-7 weeks...
Traded from Chicago (N) to New York (A) on 1/31/1970 (Going to CHC: 3B T. Conigliaro, LF C. Yastrzemski, P T. Wilshusen. Going to NYY: C J. Ferguson, 2B D. Lopes, 1B J. Young, P E. Stephenson)...
Had first career hit on 4/18/1971, off Masanori Murakami (CLE)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/19/1971, off Ken T. Johnson (CLE)...
Drove in 7 runs against Texas on 4/11/1972...
Was selected to the 1972 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/20/1973, hitting .348 with 3 HR, 11 RBI...
Was selected to the 1973 Allstar game...
Drove in 7 runs against Detroit on 9/13/1975...
Drove in 6 runs against Cleveland on 6/29/1976...
Won World Series with New York (A) in 1976...
